pages.text: Parexus is an acanthodian fish that has spines on each of its fins.$(br)Parexus had a large anterior dorsal fin spine. As it was quite small, it was probably preyed upon by larger predatory fish like the placoderms of its time.
$(l)Eats:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish Food$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
